did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Ward Center for Nuclear Sciences records, 1955-2006.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes reports, minutes of meetings, as built-drawings, manuals, visitor registers, and log books concerning the nuclear reactor in Ward Hall and the Ward Center for Nuclear Sciences.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Ward Laboratory was built in the 1960s for instruction and research in the field of nuclear engineering, first in Cornell's School of Applied and Engineering Physics and then as the Nuclear Science and Engineering Program. In 1995 the College of Engineering disbanded the program, but in 1997 the Lab became the Ward Center for Nuclear Sciences, a campus-wide center. Howard Aderhold was the center director from 1962 until 2006. The TRIGA (teaching, research, isotope, General Atomics) Mark II nuclear reactor was decommissioned in 2001.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes reports, minutes of meetings, as built-drawings, manuals, visitor registers, and log books concerning the nuclear reactor in Ward Hall and the Ward Center for Nuclear Sciences. Also a set of slides of the Ward Center.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University. Ward Center for Nuclear Sciences.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 6, 13, and 9 are restricted to permission of the University Counsel's Office and the University Radiation Safety Officer.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Ward Center for Nuclear Sciences Records, #16-15-3596. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: Folder of misc. publications, diagrams and reactor dedication program located in box 7, slides of Cornell Nuclear Reactor Lab in box 15.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Radiation Safety Committee
Box 1

Series IV. Reports and Publications
Box 6, 8-11, 13, 15

Series VII. International Conference on the Peaceful Uses of Atomic Energy - Geneva, Switzerland
Boxes 14-15
